result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant

Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James A. Clarksen appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Iii (appearing specially for Attorney Kranjek) appears, by video for James A. Clarksen. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
Inducement received, dated 04-21-2022.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 06-03-2022
Further proceedings scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:29 am.

1:47 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James A. Clarksen in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Pozorski III in court for James A. Clarksen. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 04-21-22 at 10:30 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.

2:29 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James A. Clarksen appeared in court. Defendant needs more time to hire an attorney.  Discussion is held about the no contact condition and the defendant able to collect his belongings from the residence.  The Court amends the conditions of bail to defendant is to have no contact with A.L.G., DOB: 08-18-1982 and any premises she  may occupy.  Court allows contact as permitted by the injunction in 22CV60.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail
 - Lori Clarksen @ 1000 Margaretha Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of strangulation and suffocation-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he provide an address, in writing, to the Clerk of Court office within 48 hours of release and have no contact with A.L.G., DOB: 08-18-1992 and any premises she may occupy.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
